There are some aspect of Zed that make him so popular in competitive and soloQ .

He's an excellent farmer thanks to AoE spells that have small energy costs, and make him able to cs efficiently even when the enemy laner puts on a decent aggression.
His mobility and safe escape options make him an excellent roamer, as he has excellent ways to get out after getting a kill, where champions like Akali, Talon or Rengar would have to rely on their team to prolonge the fight until they are safe.
His ultimate combo is almost a sure kill in terms of damage (even against full health) thanks to a synergy with Botrk (as Death Mark reapplies a % of the damage you dealt with each basic attack. Of course, it also reapplies the damage such as Spellblade, but the great aspect of Death Mark +Botrk is that it also reapplies the Active damage. )
This forces players to build Zhonya's , QSS, or being above 200 Armor to absorb his burst, which, alone, puts a lot of pressure into cornering opponents into specific builds.

EDIT: Actually , the only thing that prevents Zed from being hit by a wild swing of the nerfbat is that QSS and Zhonya's aren't totally worthless items.

Zed is the pen-ultimate Duelist assassin.

The game shifted out of split pushing, dueling, and assassin's for a while.

It shifted back into them, and Zed returns.

Zed isn't OP, he has clear definitive weaknesses -- NOW (S3 Worlds he did NOT)

-------

Riot seems to have an idea of the problem with League currently based on their recent statement regarding alternative strategies.
Right now, teams do their best to bypass the laning phase and make it to the mid-game where they execute either "Deathball" or "Split Push"
Currently "Deathball" is the most effective, with Zed being one of the best for "Split Push" and being passable in a "Deathball".  Since there aren't really any other effective strategies worth playing, they champions best at the two dominant strategies seem exceedingly OP.

Alistar, Maokai, Ryze, Khazix.... all the most picked champions are crazy good in deathball compositions.

Teams have gotten better at dealing with Pick compositions, so we see less and less of those compositions.  (Thresh remains as he works with EVERY composition in existence)

Any luck we'll see items to support other strategies other than "smash your face into their face HARDER"

What is Zeds weakness?  

High damage, safety, mobility, high burst, immune to jungler ganks,  energy resource.  Low cds spam.

What exactly is Zeds weakness?

In terms of his role (burst assassin) I actually think he's one of the best designs, there's a ton of counterplay to his rotations and cool stuff there, the part where he's a little too strong (IMO) is his laning because when you give an assassin a very safe lane with strong wave clear it means you can never really shut them down, they'll just reach their item spikes a little later or sooner depending.

Manaless harass in lane is pretty annoying, on Akali (who has her issues don't get me wrong) it's balanced because her Q doesn't do a whole lot unless you melee her pre-6 like an idiot, on Talon it's balanced because he has mana, Zed is a pain because his harass has no cost and crazy high range. That and his excellent wave clear means he's gonna be S-tier for a long time because it's very difficult to shut him down and he can just push and go roam whenever he wants.

In general assassins should have a weak laning phase, or at least *some* kind of weakness during laning, because they are usually strong on every other front. Zed doesn't have this which is where the complaints come from I think.
